reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports by 18 January 2013, briefing by the end of July 2012
summary:
6. Stresses the importance of security sector reform and urges international partners to support Burundi's efforts to professionalize and enhance national security services.

7. Calls on Burundi to finalize a new Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper (PRSP II) with clear peacebuilding priorities and an implementation plan.

8. Encourages Burundi, the Peacebuilding Commission, and partners to honour commitments made under the Strategic Framework for Peacebuilding.

9. Calls on Burundi to prevent human rights violations and bring those responsible to justice.

10. Stresses the need for thorough investigations into serious crimes, including extrajudicial killings.

11. Calls on Burundi to promote and protect human rights, support the National Independent Human Rights Commission and the Office of the Ombudsman, and fight impunity.

12. Encourages Burundi to establish transitional justice mechanisms, including a Truth and Reconciliation Commission.

13. Takes note of progress on benchmarks for the future evolution of BNUB and requests an update by 31 May 2012.

14. Requests the Secretary-General to keep the Council informed on BNUB's mandate implementation and this resolution, with a briefing by July 2012 and a report by 18 January 2013.

15. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
